resource.name: ANCCustomCodes
resource.title: Extended Codes CodeSystem
resource.description: Set of codes representing all concepts used in the implementation guide

concept.definition: Before each contact, the health worker should check whether the woman has any of the danger signs listed here – if yes, she should refer to the hospital urgently; if no, she should continue to the normal contact
Woman has a bluish discolouration of the skin
Woman has a fever (body temperature greater than or equal to 37°C)
Woman is about to give birth
Woman is in severe pain (not abdominal pain)
Woman is in severe abdominal pain
Select the reason why you are closing the woman's ANC record
The woman had a live birth
The woman was lost to follow-up
The woman moved away to another jurisdiction, her birthing status is unknown

resource.name: ANCDT01DangerSigns
resource.title: ANC.DT.01 Danger Signs
resource.description: Before each contact, during the Quick Check, the health worker should check whether the woman has any of the danger signs listed here – if yes, she should be referred to the hospital urgently; if no, the normal contact should be continued as normal

action.title: Check for Danger Signs
action.textEquivalent: This is a danger sign that indicates that the woman needs urgent management

expression.expression: Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral

action.title: Proceed with ANC contact
action.textEquivalent: If no danger signs are present, the health worker can continue with the normal ANC contact

action.title: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis
action.description: Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis
action.textEquivalent: Bluish discolouration around the mucous membranes in the mouth, lips and tongue.

expression.expression: Should Proceed with ANC contact OR Referral for Central cyanosis
